result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucille M Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court not opposed to transfer of the probation to another county

Defendant Lucille M Miller in court, in custody with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to the charge in 15CF145.  15CF121 is DRI.   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court orders:
one year jail - STAYED
18 months Probation w/held Court not opposed to transfer of probation to another county
No contact w/Mark Bremer or Lisa Bremer unless victim and agent agree
Apology letter to both victim
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.

32 days sentence credit
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.
No contact with LB

Defendant Lucille M Miller in court, in custody with attorney Gavin Grubofski appearing specially for Attorney Jessica Schuster.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF121 & 15CF145 - Statements by Grubofski - Now has transportation to and from court - Defendant turned herself in as she knew of the warrant - State is requesting cash bail - Court sets $500 cash bond on each case - If counsel wants hearing heard at an earlier time a motion can be filed  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Attorney Jessica L Schuster appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Defense updates the court as to the whereabouts of the deft. State requests a bench warrant.  Court grants the request of the state.
Status conference on October 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lucille M Miller not in court.  Attorney Jessica Schuster does appear.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Defense updates the court and does not know the whereabouts of the deft.   State requests that the Jury Trial be removed and set for a status hearing.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
